website_summaries.verdict: Versatile, feature-packed toaster that works well for small kitchens and won’t break the bank.
pros: Extra-long and wide slots can accommodate a variety of breads
Slots are self-centering for even toasting
Offers defrost, bagel, and longer settings for versatility
Crumb tray is easy to empty and clean
cons: Some users find it takes a long time to fully toast bread even on the darkest shade setting

customer_reviews.title: New KItchenAid Toaster looks like a winner.
customer_reviews.text: The Slim Profile, Art-Deco looks and ease of operation IMO are great. Unlike other Models of KitchenAid Toasters that got mixed reviews over performance and especially the annoying "Safety Belt Buzzer) that goes off at the end of ever Toasting Cycle (without) a Turn-Off Mode, this Toaster simply does its job and ends the toasting cycle without an annoying alarm clock to remind you to remove your Toast/Bagel and butter it before it turns stone cold. Haven't had it long but so far, I think its a winner. My old KitchenAid Toaster in Empire Red that when through a Plastic Lift Handle that broke off at least once a year was finally retired after over 10 years of daily use.
customer_reviews.author: Tropical Phil

customer_reviews.title: Works Just Like I wanted It To
customer_reviews.text: I got this because I had long slices of bread that wouldn't fit in my normal toaster. These were mainly sourdough slices. I can put in a single slice and it comes out just the way I like. It thaws frozen slices too since I keep my bread in the freezer.
customer_reviews.author: John T.

customer_reviews.title: Mostly terrific
customer_reviews.text: Mostly we like it very much...if there is one tiny flaw it is that even on the darkest toast setting it takes two full cycles to fully toast if one likes well toasted breads.
customer_reviews.author: d-online

customer_reviews.title: Very versatile toaster
customer_reviews.text: Nice long slot , usable for most artisan bread, does a good job with bagels and croissants. Attractive deco look and great red color
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline Ambrose

customer_reviews.title: functional design isn't the greatest
customer_reviews.text: I really like the look of the toaster in my kitchen. It cooks things well too. We have been cooking bagels in it and they cook well. I do however, have a few complaints. The cord on the bottom...is prompted to wrap around to the front...making you turn the toaster backwards for plug in. So, if you don't want a long cord hanging out..that is a problem. Another issue is the toasting function. The "toast" function pops up after 10 seconds and does nothing. I have to put it on the "frozen" function to cook toast properly.
customer_reviews.author: lwinslow

customer_reviews.title: Another great KitchenAid toaster
customer_reviews.text: Replaced our old KitchenAid toaster with this one. Like it even better! All the controls are on the end so when it's placed against the wall it takes up very little counter space. Even toasting, easy to understand controls. Yes, I recommend it. Great toaster.
customer_reviews.author: Susan E Blaesing

customer_reviews.title: Premium for KitchenAid worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Very well made. Controls are intuitive (little bagel indicator on slot to show direction -- in bagel mode one side gets more toasted) especially if you quickly scan user guide. Power cord is not wimpy but substantial. Beware of length (16") if you have spot picked out. Toasted perfectly so far (heat slide in middle) -- unclear why others had problem.
customer_reviews.author: TexasFarmBoy

customer_reviews.title: Toast does not get toasted enough.
customer_reviews.text: I like the way this toaster looks, and it’s slimness however it does not toast my toast enough even at the maximum toast Ievel. I end up having to go back and toast it once again for a half to a full cycle of toasting again which takes too much time and is inconvenient to have to do twice.
customer_reviews.author: loves books

customer_reviews.title: Just ok.  Not worth the price for just the looks.
customer_reviews.text: It's a decent toaster. We like the style etc which is unusual compared to most normal two slot toasters. What I don't like... The darkness setting is on max and it just barely toasts the bread. It's slow to get there too. The added buttons for bagel etc seem intuitive, but the + time button doesn't make sense. It should just be, drop the lever, press that button and it runs longer. Instead it's a multi-step process that seems to not work as it pops the lever back up quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Clay Shooter

customer_reviews.title: No Regrets - Toasts Evenly
customer_reviews.text: Craftsmanship and design are as important to me as functionality when it come to appliances. Design = 4/5 Craftsmanship - 3/5 Functionality - 4/5 Value - 5/5 I've had no issues with the evenness of the toasting elements (as other reviewers have stated). I was disappointed that the unit does not have a metal case to match my other KitchenAid appliance. However, for $65.00 I was expecting too much. I almost purchased the $300 KitchenAid toaster but it was not in my budget. I will probably purchase it once this one wears out.
customer_reviews.author: Arj USA

customer_reviews.title: Toasts a little lopsided
customer_reviews.text: The toast burns on one edge even when we put the break all the way to one end. I wouldn't buy again. It needs a separator for the bread. It also toasts much darker after the first slice.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon_Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very uneven
customer_reviews.text: I needed a toaster that can accept the long and unusual shape of homemade bread. This is the only one that caught my eyes. However, as many have indicated, the toast came out really uneven, a lot of times the top and bottom edges would get burned a bit. I don't really understand why it is so difficult to make a good toaster since the parts behind it really aren't that complicated. Overall, it does get the job done so I am keeping it until I find something else that can replace it.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Tang

customer_reviews.title: Nice Toaster
customer_reviews.text: If you are like me you've read many reviews for multiple toasters. I am perplexed why toasters received such negative reviews. It's seems like such a simple function. Well I'm very happy with this toaster. I like the single slot for wider cut bread. I use the toaster 95% toasting bagels and they come out fine.
customer_reviews.author: Single Again

customer_reviews.title: Design Needs Changed
customer_reviews.text: The controls are on the end of the toaster, so I have to pull the end of the toaster out towards me so I can see the controls. The darkness setting lever and the lever to push the toast down are way, way too close together! This is a real pain trying not to hit the wrong lever.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: Stylish and works well
customer_reviews.text: Finally I found a toaster that I actually want to leave out on the counter for people to see. Stylish and unique style. Beautiful and eorks extremely well.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy J. Weiss

customer_reviews.title: Plastic and cheap feeling. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed. For a $54 dollar toaster (supposedly $99 normally) I did not expect a PLASTIC toaster. Expected metal. This feels very cheap and even the knobs feel cheap. I love my mixer and expected the same quartile from this name brand.
customer_reviews.author: MelRey

customer_reviews.title: Takes a long time to toast and still not dark enough
customer_reviews.text: Stays cool while on. Looks good. Truly holds two slices. 3 stars because it takes a long time to toast and at the darkest setting still have to toast some more in most cases. The toast more setting doesn’t really do much. Still have to just start over and then abort before it goes too far. Wish the middle setting would toast most breads with some flexibility. Instead it is always set to max and then still not enough.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen Brochmann

customer_reviews.title: Missing an important feature
customer_reviews.text: I asked if this model had a signal that indicated that the toasting cycle was done. I was told yes but it does not have this feature. I want one that does. That is the main reason I bought the toaster. Please help me fine what I am looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Arthurs

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it.
customer_reviews.text: This doesn't really toast properly. Have to use two cycles just for toast. The button that is supposed to extend time of toasting didn't work at all. For what it does and how it actually works, it's too big and clunky.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Even Temperature Distribution
customer_reviews.text: I love this toaster because it is simple to use and very high quality. The best part is even toasting! With the long slice you have even temperature distribution that a dual slice cannot achieve.
customer_reviews.author: TimPro

customer_reviews.title: Smart looking toaster that does the job for a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.text: The toaster does the job. I like that it has a small footprint. Does not overwhelm the countertop. Since it remains out all day and only used for a brief time that is a plus. I can’t imagine paying much more to get the same results. Very nice modern design. The outside does not get hot which my previous toaster did. Even toasting. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Mark J. Silverstein

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: So far so good, i use it 2 or 3 times a week .. and it works ok . Its bigger than i thought but the idea of the two slice together is really nice.
customer_reviews.author: Romi

customer_reviews.title: Bad KitchenAid toaster
customer_reviews.text: Lousy toaster! must run toast through two or three times expected more from KitchenAid
customer_reviews.author: Rat

customer_reviews.title: Is my unit defective??
customer_reviews.text: If I crank the toaster level up to the darkest setting, and put in a piece of white bread, the bread pops up, after this cycle, still white and hardly toasted at all. If I toast the bread a second time, again, at the darkest setting, then it pops up as toasted, but by then, the bread is all dried out, like a giant crouton. What I want to know, is....is my unit defective???
customer_reviews.author: Just a guy in North Dakota

customer_reviews.title: It fails to toast evenly & completely quits after a few months.
customer_reviews.text: I’m one person using this toaster for 8 months. One side of the toaster completely quit working. The toasting coils became dim at 4 months. It looks attractive but Does NOT work. I wouldn’t buy it again!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer kanaka

customer_reviews.title: Yes
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my daughter in-law. She loves it. She likes that it’s a space saver.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie H

customer_reviews.title: Perfect and really cool design.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for a Christmas gift and he loves it. Cool looking for the minimalist and is the exact match for his kitchenaid mixer!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth  A Norton

customer_reviews.title: I use to watch the brave little toaster every time I went to nana’s house
customer_reviews.text: Fits perfect in the space we have but I struggle to toast things evenly. Even on the highest setting I end up toasting more than one round. But I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Youngblood

customer_reviews.title: Kitchenaid
customer_reviews.text: its Kitchenaid...and a great design. Slim design fits well on my small kitchen counter...wish the cord would retract...its a toaster, seems versatile...i have only used it for toast and waffles...it gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: susan d

customer_reviews.title: Buy it
customer_reviews.text: Great toaster — bagel option is perfect but takes awhile. Really best toaster I’ve owned!
customer_reviews.author: GC

customer_reviews.title: Slow
customer_reviews.text: This thing is very nice to look at BUT IT IS SLOW, I got rid of my old toaster because it had become so slow, now I wish I had kept it, also the temperature control is unreliable, my daughter says she is going to go to Wal-Mart and spend $10.00 for a cheap toaster that will work. Very frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: shonas

customer_reviews.title: Great toaster
customer_reviews.text: First, it's fun to see--beautiful design and color. Second, it accommodates special bread shapes. Third, it toasts very uniformly--possibly because it is lower power and takes longer. Fourth, all the controls feel good and work well.
customer_reviews.author: J Baker

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy it!
customer_reviews.text: Don’t waste your money!!! Doesn’t toast well . Now after maybe a couple of months it’s making a buzzing noise. We thought paying more we would get a good toaster. Never again.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie

customer_reviews.title: Not great...
customer_reviews.text: Mostly plastic, not a stainless/metal body as described. Therefore, it’s lightweight and tips easily. Every setting produces “lightly toasted” bread at best. Wish I had sent it back!
customer_reviews.author: bmgj out June

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money and space
customer_reviews.text: This product was delivered in May 3, 2020 and this product stopped working on May 10, 2020. Prior to it dying for no apparent reason, the product worked as advertised. I spent an exorbitant amount of money on a fancy counter top accessory that has zero use. Heed my advice, steer clear of this hunk a junk!
customer_reviews.author: Cole

customer_reviews.title: Great for all lengths of bread
customer_reviews.text: I like the fact that I can put in long artisan slices of bread. Have got the settings down pat yet. But I do love my toaster!!
customer_reviews.author: Concetta Czapla

customer_reviews.title: Slim design & makes good toast
customer_reviews.text: Wishing I had replaced my old toaster (another brand) sooner! This looks great, and, more critically, makes good toast with a variety of breads and bagels. The buttons are a little small, but that's not a big deal to me. Daily use for about a month now - I'm very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: RC-01/138

customer_reviews.title: Didn't toast dark enough like our old kitchenaid
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't cook toast dark enough even at the darkest setting. We had a Kitchenaid toaster previously for 19 yrs and it was perfect! We used to set it at 9 for darkest. Understandably, it went out on us last month, which prompted this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Toaster
customer_reviews.text: I replaced an old Kitchen aid toaster (it was old and dirty) with this one. It is equal to the task and worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Too Expensive
customer_reviews.text: This toaster does not toast any better than a $20.00 one. The added features are unnecessary and a waste of money!
customer_reviews.author: Evelyn M.

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Product! Great design!
customer_reviews.text: Love the single long slot and the extra controls for bagels, frozen, toast, etc. Very well engineered ! A weliocome addition to any kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Darlene Squires

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Great color and perfect color match for the mixer. Easy to use and takes up little counter space even though it can toast 2 pieces at a time
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not deep enough.
customer_reviews.text: It’s not deep enough. Slices of large bread do not get toasted on top part.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy!
customer_reviews.text: The long slot is a single slot so if you are toasting rye bread two slices will not fit. When I toasted a slice of bread to test it, the bread tasted like plastic and there was a burnt plastic smell in the kitchen for some time afterward.
customer_reviews.author: Marisa Moffa

customer_reviews.title: ease of use
customer_reviews.text: kitchen aid products are number one for money. owned several
customer_reviews.author: Charlie Hagler

customer_reviews.title: Works only 10% of the time
customer_reviews.text: This toaster only works 10% of the time and the customer service for this manufacturer has been HORRIBLE! I basically spent $80 for a toaster that I cannot get a replacement or a return for. Buyer beware!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Feddersen

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the cost
customer_reviews.text: This thing takes forever to toast bread. It's like it doesn't get hot enough
customer_reviews.author: mcombs01

customer_reviews.title: Good toaster
customer_reviews.text: Hamburger buns tend to get stuck. Not quite as wide as older Kitchenaid toaster. Otherwise, does a good job of toasting.
customer_reviews.author: Gary L. Hasley

customer_reviews.title: great toaster
customer_reviews.text: easy to use, slim line design fits nicely on counter, toast to perfection
customer_reviews.author: Joan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect matte black toaster.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a matte black toaster to match my matte black KitchenAid Mixer and this was perfect! Love the long, slim design.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn

customer_reviews.title: Toast gets stuck inside
customer_reviews.text: Difficult to remove the toast, tends to get stuck inside. Very annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Teo

customer_reviews.title: For the money I would not buy again
customer_reviews.text: Toast and it can never get it right one day it's too light and then another day it’s just bread
customer_reviews.author: patricia

customer_reviews.title: THE toaster I picked after trying 3
customer_reviews.text: I have tried a few different toasters, this is THE one I love the most. It looks so good and works great as well.
customer_reviews.author: GS

customer_reviews.title: Well made and space efficient.
customer_reviews.text: Working well for now and great design for a traditional or modern kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: djxxxx

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: Didn't toast - indicator lights didn't work - had to return
customer_reviews.author: Jeannine Laplace

customer_reviews.title: Good toaster, nice esthetics, fits into slim space in my kitchen
customer_reviews.text: Works well on bread and English muffins. I like the button that adds just a little more browning.
customer_reviews.author: Brian S. Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Matching colors in kitchen
customer_reviews.text: Love the shape and size and color. The matte finish blends with other colors.
customer_reviews.author: AMC

customer_reviews.title: Not so impressive with the toasting
customer_reviews.text: I had some frozen sandwich bread, relatively thinly slided and commercially made, not very dense, as my first test toast: set shade control knob to halfway, put in the toaster straight from the freezer, pushed down the lever, hit the defrost button and...warm bread with slight firmness to surface popped up a few minutes later. No hint of browning at all. Repeated next day with same bread, shade control knob to almost top setting, still had same result. Not impressed: the extra step--the defrost button--doesn't seem to add much except complexity to setup. It's a toaster, it will handle a variety of bread sizes, but despite the pretty red color, not loving it. It's functional, but not a great device.
customer_reviews.author: Diane in Los Angeles

customer_reviews.title: the top gets very hot be careful when removing your toast
customer_reviews.text: This is the best toaster I have had, but the of toaster gets very hot on the stainless band on the top and care must be observed when removing toast even the extra lift does not help if toast is small I wish it had a sourdough setting because they are thicker slice of bread and need a little longer toast time this toaster is great because of its long slots I have had many different toasters and brands but without long slots they can't toast sourdough bread without cutting slices of bread overall best toaster I have had
customer_reviews.author: Rich Rouquette

customer_reviews.title: Worst toaster I've ever owned.
customer_reviews.text: My last toaster was a reliable practical KitchenAide...I wore it out. This new KitchenAide is ridiculous and poorly designed. The controls are on the narrow edge and can't be seen, the lettering/symbols are so small you have to twist the toaster and hold it up to you. The lever to supposedly set the brownness is unstable, It doesn't toast well in any of it's modes. The basket is narrow and doesn't pop up high enough to allow you to retrieve the toast unless the slice is the size of Wonder Breadwithout sticking a knife in to get it. Save your money. I'm in search of something better. Too many silly gadgets and not enough sound engineering.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline M. Haber

customer_reviews.title: Good toast nice functions
customer_reviews.text: pretty toaster. Toasted evenly good toast on all sides. Pushes up higher. Several functions that are useful. Overpriced, but after a long search and returning 2 toasters. I paid the bucks but it’s sturdy feeling. Metal. Shiny and pretty. And the long 2 slice takes up less space on the counter. And it work as a toaster should. I just hope it lasts 20 years! correction: toaster is PLASTIC outside not metal. but is shiny.
customer_reviews.author: DEO

customer_reviews.title: Too many settings
customer_reviews.text: I bought this toaster because I need a wide-slot, and my previous KitchenAid quit on me. This one has several clever settings I don't use. The only one I thought would be good is the "a little more", to add extra time. Unfortunately, it's not enough. I have to put the bread down a second time, as with the older, simpler toaster.
customer_reviews.author: Gunter Hofmann

customer_reviews.title: not as good as we hoped
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love it. Cool looking design. Didn't count on the odd size that I attracted me would be so awkward for storage and use. The dual levers are too easy to hit the wrong one and change the temp. The single slot is great for one piece of french bread but two slices of regular bread overlap. I would try the brand again . . . but chose another one. NIce color though. We have the black.
customer_reviews.author: roy hobbs

customer_reviews.title: Great toaster
customer_reviews.text: I got this because 1) it’s kitchenaid and all my appliances from them are outstanding and 2) it is a unique shape that saves counter space and 3) it’s a sleek matte black. It doesn’t disappoint, works well and is saving me the weird countertop space that is wasted by a regular sized toaster.
customer_reviews.author: A. Steed

customer_reviews.title: Shape
customer_reviews.text: I like that it is red. Toast is as expected. It is different in that it is long which will accommodate homemade breads etc. but if you just want a plain old toaster get the other one. I have a small space and wish I had gotten that one. It really is a nice toaster though. Have to get used to the long shape of this one.
customer_reviews.author: Lisababe

customer_reviews.title: Better than I hoped for
customer_reviews.text: Toasted perfectly. I was worried about the poor reviews but the long single opening was what I wanted and there aren't many to choose from. Cord length and position was not a problem. Cord can be re routed on the bottom to adjust to what you need. A very nice toaster, hoping it lasts half as long as my last one.
customer_reviews.author: Joel R.

customer_reviews.title: Replacement toaster.
customer_reviews.text: We had a similar toaster that was given as a gift when we bought our house. The old one was quite old. So we got this as a replacement. As we replace our small appliances, we are going with the black color. This is perfect
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: Loving it!
customer_reviews.text: Loving my new red toaster. Added just the right pop of color to my kitchen counter. Not only does it look super sharp, but it toasts evenly on both sides of the bread. Easy to adjust temperature and great pop-up feature for a bit of extra lift when needed.
customer_reviews.author: S. E. Hanson

customer_reviews.title: Compact, browns well, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: It's a bit more expensive than other toasters, but Kitchen Aid has a good reputation and the toaster has a good solid "feel" to it. The body is very slim and fits nicely next to my Keurig
customer_reviews.author: Dieter Ballmann

customer_reviews.title: It’s an OK toaster.
customer_reviews.text: I like the slim design and color. It is very slow and takes a while to get used to the settings for how you want your toast, bagels, etc.
customer_reviews.author: June

customer_reviews.title: great toaster
customer_reviews.text: Selection buttons are very small and have symbols on them. Not sure why that was done. Toaster is great otherwise. Thats why I gave it 4 stars
customer_reviews.author: catmn

customer_reviews.title: Good but slow
customer_reviews.text: While it does work as it should, it takes almost twice as long as a double slot toaster to brown anything. On the plus side you can fit bagels or other thick cut breads in it
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Toaster
customer_reviews.text: But I wish the toasting option buttons were located above the darkness slide control. It would then be easier to see and choose the correct button. The product does toast well. And the one long slot is great because we eat a lot of odd (wide) slices.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Loved :)
customer_reviews.text: It's not a heavy product, kitchen aid products tend to be quite heavy. But this toaster is just perfect! Loved it :)
customer_reviews.author: Virginia Lucia N Brandao

customer_reviews.title: I'm happy
customer_reviews.text: The buttons are a little hard to see and having them on the side is kind of wonky but I'm happy nonetheless. It does it job.
customer_reviews.author: Racheal

customer_reviews.title: Stylish and functional!
customer_reviews.text: Such a unique looking toaster. It’s functional and very stylish!
customer_reviews.author: Ladybug

customer_reviews.title: basically just plastic
customer_reviews.text: its almost entirely plastic also, this empire red doesnt match the kitchenaid mixer empire red. its slightly lighter and pinker.
customer_reviews.author: Nakina

customer_reviews.title: Great for toasting larger pieces of bread, croissants, etc
customer_reviews.text: It’s pretty long and does take up lots of counter space, but I love how I can toast larger things.
customer_reviews.author: Abbi Sims

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for tight counters
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Wish it came in matte white, but I get lots of compliments
customer_reviews.author: CorinneVanOodle

customer_reviews.title: Quality toaster
customer_reviews.text: This toaster is really nice, good quality and nice looking sitting out on the counter
customer_reviews.author: RRogers

product_meta.title: KitchenAid KMT3115BM 2 Slice Long Slot High-Lift Lever Toaster, Black Matte
product_meta.description: Size:2 Slice| Color:Black MatteMake every morning simply delicious and easily toast your favorite breads, bagels and more with ease. This toaster features extra long, extra-wide slots to toast a variety of shapes and sizes, including homemade or Artisan breads. For added convenience the high lift lever ensures you can reach small pieces of bread easily.
feature_bullets: Extra long, extra wide slots with self centering slots for even heating and the flexibility to toast a variety of breads without adjusting bread size.
High lift lever to easily reach small pieces of bread.
Defrost, Bagel, and Little Longer settings to toast frozen pastries or breads, the cut side of bagels or english muffins or toast a “little longer” at the touch of a button.
Removable crumb tray for easy emptying and cleaning. Hand wash only.
20% smaller* so you can maximize your counter space.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars220 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
